get.description: Returns SEO meta fields plus schema.org JSON-LD (ProfilePage/Person/BreadcrumbList/VideoObject list) and recent public videos. Intended for Next.js SSR so Google can crawl an HTML profile page with rich structured data.

schema.description: Influencer id (ULID preferred; numeric DB id also supported)

put.description: Sets the final schedule. Moves request from approved -> scheduled. If WhatsApp is configured, a template notification may be sent to the influencer (best-effort; does not affect the API response).

Superadmin: unassign DOP from photoshoot request

get.description: Lists PR commission ledger rows for operational payout/settlement.

get.description: Lists ads for a specific brand that the current PR user is assigned to.
Fetches an ad by id if the current PR user is assigned to the owning brand.
Lists PR commission ledger rows for the current PR user.
Lists referral commission ledger rows for operational payout/settlement.

put.description: Marks a referral commission row as paid (idempotent).

get.summary: Public landing: list influencers with videos
get.description: Returns influencers with basic profile info (name, handle, profilePicUrl, badges) and their Bunny videos for landing pages.
Returns landing page content sections (Trusted/Results/Testimonials) in one response.

get.summary: Public landing: case studies / results section

post.description: Creates a short-lived OTP for the given phone. In production, OTP is sent via WhatsApp Cloud API using a pre-approved template (configure WHATSAPP_* env vars).
Mobile obtains a Google ID token (idToken) using Google Sign-In SDK and sends it here. For first-time users, include role. Server verifies token using GOOGLE_CLIENT_IDS / GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID env.

post.summary: Google Sign-In start (returns linkToken if phone verification needed)
post.description: Verifies Google ID token. If googleSub already linked, returns session. Otherwise returns linkRequired=true plus a short-lived linkToken to be used with /api/auth/google/link after verifying phone OTP.

post.summary: Google Sign-In link (link to existing phone or create new)
post.description: Verifies phone OTP (default behavior), then if the phone already exists it links googleSub to that user; otherwise creates a new user (requires role). Set GOOGLE_LINK_REQUIRE_OTP=false to temporarily disable OTP enforcement for linking (not recommended for production).

Verifies a Google ID token. If the user already exists, returns a session. If first-time signup, returns a short-lived signupToken plus basic profile so the client can collect role + phone and call /api/auth/google/complete.
Completes first-time Google signup using the signupToken from /api/auth/google/init and collects required onboarding fields.
Creates a short-lived OTP for MPIN reset. In production, OTP is sent via WhatsApp Cloud API using a pre-approved template (configure WHATSAPP_* env vars).

otp.description: Returned only in non-production for debugging/testing.

value.bio: Fitness + lifestyle creator. Reels, product reviews, and brand collabs.

get.summary: Get my referral code and stats
get.description: Returns (and auto-generates if missing) the influencer referral code, who referred me (if any), and referral commission totals. Referral earnings are recorded when the referred influencer receives a completed payout.

post.description: Links the current influencer to a referrer one time. Cannot be changed once set.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of referral commission entries earned by the current influencer. Example math: if referred influencer B earns 2000 and PLATFORM_COMMISSION_RATE=0.20 then platform commission is 400; if REFERRAL_COMMISSION_RATE=0.25 then referrer earns 100.

post.description: Sends a WhatsApp marketing template to invite someone using the current influencer's referral code. Returns a frontend shareUrl that includes the referral code.

get.summary: Influencer: get my latest photoshoot request (no ULID)

post.summary: Influencer: submit photoshoot request (answers + slot time) in one call
post.description: Single-call flow for frontend: send the full questionnaire (details) + preferred slot time. Creates a pending request with requestedStartAt/requestedEndAt. Superadmin must still approve and schedule the final time.
Alias of PUT /api/influencers/me/pricing for clients that use POST.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optional. If omitted, returns all statuses. Case-insensitive; supports synonyms like 'Approve' -> 'verified'.

schema.description: Influencer id (ULID preferred; numeric DB id also supported)

get.description: Returns the same response shape as /api/influencers/ads/media but only for the authenticated influencer.

post.summary: Init Bunny video upload for own ad post (preferred)
post.description: Step 1/2. Creates a Bunny Stream video record and attaches it to the influencer's ad post. Returns a server upload endpoint that accepts raw bytes (no multipart).

201.description: Created (a new ad post was created)

put.summary: Upload video bytes to Bunny via server (preferred)
put.description:
Step 2/2. Uploads raw bytes (application/octet-stream) to the server, which streams them to Bunny Stream. This avoids multipart parsing issues on Windows/PowerShell.

Example (PowerShell):
- `curl.exe -X PUT -H "Authorization: Bearer <TOKEN>" -H "Content-Type: application/octet-stream" --upload-file "ad-video.mp4" http://localhost:4000/api/influencers/me/ads/video/<GUID>/upload`

parameters.name: Content-Length
parameters.description: Required for streaming uploads. Most clients (curl --upload-file) set this automatically.

post.summary: Upload Bunny video for own ad post
post.description:
Uploads a video file to Bunny Stream and attaches it to the influencer's ad post (single-call multipart).

Recommended (more reliable): use the 2-step flow: `POST /api/influencers/me/ads/video/init` then `PUT /api/influencers/me/ads/video/{guid}/upload` with `application/octet-stream` (no multipart).

Important (Windows/PowerShell): use `curl.exe` and DO NOT manually set the `Content-Type: multipart/form-data` header (curl must include a boundary). The server attempts to recover missing boundary when possible, but correct clients are still recommended. Filenames containing `#` or spaces can also break shell commands; rename the file (e.g. `ad-video.mp4`) while testing.

201.description: Created (a new ad post was created)

post.description: Generates an influencer profile pack. Basic mode uses name/niche/city. Advanced mode accepts a short brief + platform metrics and returns a structured brand-ready profile under jsonLd.kaburluProfile. Frontend: read rich generated sections from response.jsonLd.kaburluProfile.

brief.description: Short influencer brief for AI (advanced mode).

platforms.description: Primary platforms, e.g. Instagram, YouTube, Podcast.

uniqueStrength.description: What makes the influencer different (advanced mode).

collaborationTypes.description: Reels, Shorts, Story, Podcast, Interview, Web Series, OTT, Voice Ads, etc.

brief.description: 13 lines about the influencer (tone, positioning, category).

city.description: Optional; if not provided and not stored, city may be blank.

platforms.description: Optional override; otherwise inferred from stored socialLinks.

Creates a new landing content entry. Prefer `PUT /api/admin/landing/{key}` if you want idempotent create/update.

patch.description: Updates an existing key using a shallow merge. Body can be any JSON object, or `{ data: ... }`.

InfluencerPhotoshootRequestCreate.description: Questionnaire + consent payload. Must include consent.termsAccepted=true and consent.publicDisplayConsent=true.

InfluencerPhotoshootBookRequest.description: Booking requires questionnaire answers + consent. If you already submitted them in the request (create/update), you can omit details here. Otherwise, include the same questionnaire payload in 'details'.

PrAdGetResponse.description: Full ad record (as stored) plus idUlid and brand summary.

AdminKycItem.description: Influencer KYC record (admin view). PAN is masked; Aadhaar hash is omitted.

status.description: Accepted values are case-insensitive. Common synonyms like 'Approve'/'Approved' map to 'verified'.
Accepted values are case-insensitive. Common synonyms like 'Approve'/'Approved' map to 'verified'.

path.description: JSON Pointer path (RFC6901). Use '/logos/-' to append to the logos array.

AdminLandingPatchRequest.description: Partial update payload. Supports either (1) shallow merge of an object, or (2) JSON Patch operations array for array appends/replacements.

oneOf.description: Shallow merge. Body can be any JSON object, or `{ data: ... }`.
JSON Patch (RFC6902) operation list. Useful to append to arrays without overwriting them.

AuthLoginRequest.description: Login using either email or phone, plus either password or mpin.

idToken.description: Google ID token obtained from Google Sign-In SDK.

role.description: Required only for first-time signup. Ignored for existing users.

phone.description: Optional phone to store during first-time signup.

idToken.description: Google ID token obtained from Google Sign-In SDK.

signupToken.description: Short-lived token to be used with /api/auth/google/complete.

phone.description: WhatsApp number in international format. Accepts digits-only (e.g., 919000000000) or E.164 (+919000000000).

email.description: Optional email used only for certain WhatsApp templates (e.g., Gmail linking).

purpose.description: Optional purpose to select a specific WhatsApp template.

otp.description: Returned only in non-production for debugging/testing.

AuthOtpVerifyRequest.description: Accepts either `otp` or legacy `code` for the 6-digit verification value.

idToken.description: Google ID token obtained from Google Sign-In SDK.

linkToken.description: Short-lived token to be used with /api/auth/google/link

AuthGoogleLinkRequest.description: Accepts either `otp` or legacy `code` for the 6-digit verification value.

role.description: Required only when creating a new user.
Required only when creating a new user.

MpinResetVerifyRequest.description: Accepts either `otp` or legacy `code` for the 6-digit verification value.

influencer.description: Present when the logged-in user role is influencer. Includes summary KYC/payment/profile flags for mobile onboarding.

brandUlid.description: Required for PR users (brand-scoped). Brand users can omit this and the brand is inferred from ownership.

InfluencerFollowers.description: Platform-wise follower counts and metrics. Known keys are documented as properties; you may also send custom numeric metrics.

InfluencerSocialLinks.description: Platform profile links. Known keys are documented as properties; you may also send custom string keys.

phone.description: Receiver WhatsApp number in international format (digits-only or E.164).

receiverName.description: Optional receiver name used in the template body.

shareUrl.description: Frontend URL including the referral code (returned for client-side sharing).

schema.description: Array of schema.org JSON-LD objects to embed into the HTML profile page.

nextCursor.description: Base64 cursor for next page, null if no more

prefetch.description: First video of next page for preloading
